errors.error_description: The installation command `pip install mteb-benchmark` is incorrect. The package is not found under this name on PyPI, causing an installation failure.
correction_candidates: pip install massive-text-embedding-benchmark
pip install mteb
conda install mteb
pip install mteb --from-github

errors.error_description: The CLI command `mteb run --m ...` uses an incorrect flag `--m`. The correct flag for specifying the model is a single-dashed `-m`, causing a command-line argument parsing error.
correction_candidates: mteb run --model sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2
mteb run -model sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2
mteb run -m sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2
mteb run --model_name sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2

errors.error_description: The link to the example script `run_mteb.py` is broken as the file does not exist at the specified path. The correct filename is `run_mteb_english.py`.
correction_candidates: Change the link to point to 'examples/run_mteb.py'.
Change the link to point to 'mteb/scripts/run_mteb_english.py'.
Change the link to point to 'scripts/run_mteb_english.py'.
Change the link to point to the 'mteb/mtebscripts' repository.
errors.golden_answer: Change the link to point to 'scripts/run_mteb_english.py'.

errors.error_description: The 'Installation' section is placed after the 'Usage' section. Users will likely try to run the code from the 'Usage' section before seeing how to install the required package, leading to a `ModuleNotFoundError`.
correction_candidates: Move the 'Installation' section to be before the 'Usage' section.
Add a note at the beginning of the 'Usage' section to install the package first.
Create a new 'Getting Started' section that includes both installation and basic usage.
Combine the 'Installation' and 'Usage' sections.
errors.golden_answer: Move the 'Installation' section to be before the 'Usage' section.

errors.error_description: The Python code example has a syntax error. The line `evaluation.run(...)` is missing a closing parenthesis, which will cause the script to fail with a `SyntaxError`.
correction_candidates: Remove the output_folder argument: evaluation.run(model)
Correct the f-string syntax: evaluation.run(model, output_folder="results/" + model_name)
Add a closing parenthesis: evaluation.run(model, output_folder=f"results/{model_name}")
Change the line to: results = evaluation.run(model)
errors.golden_answer: Add a closing parenthesis: evaluation.run(model, output_folder=f"results/{model_name}")
